name: Blend'it
tagline: Open-source crowd and world generator for blender3D
body:
# Welcome to Blend'it pages.

We are 9 Master students in the ENS Lyon. We will be working on the development of Python scripts and add-ons to Blender, to produce realistic crowd and swarm generators, as well as environment generators. 

Below are some pictures taken from articles presenting techniques we would like to add to Blender:

### Crowd generation

Real crossing in Tokyo, Japan:

![Real crossing in Tokyo, Japan](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/blendit/blendit.github.io/master/images/PLE-2.png)

Simulated crowd  ![presented here](http://gamma.cs.unc.edu/PLE/):

![Simulated crowd presented in http://gamma.cs.unc.edu/PLE/](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/blendit/blendit.github.io/master/images/PLE-1.png)

### Environment generation

Image taken from !["A declarative approach to procedural modeling of virtual worlds", Smelik et al.](https://graphics.tudelft.nl/Publications-new/2011/STDB11a/STDB11a.pdf):

![Image taken from "A declarative approach to procedural modeling of virtual worlds", Smelik et al.](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/blendit/blendit.github.io/master/images/env1.jpg)

* Environment plugin development @bboisson, @coma94, **@gullcomb**, @omariott, @rmonat 
* GUI development @coma94, @gullcomb, **@vlutfall**
* Trailer @d1laj, **@coma94**, @joseif

## Support and Contact

Please get in touch with @rmonat if you want more informations concerning this project. We are always interested in new ideas, and Blender artists to test our scripts.
